{"title":"page 11","subjec":{},"descri":{},"creato":{},"publis":{},"date":{},"year":{},"format":{},"reposi":{},"collec":{},"reposa":{},"rights":{},"digitb":{},"langua":{},"topics":{},"cite":{},"notes":{},"notesa":{},"source":{},"box":{},"folder":{},"identi":{},"relati":{},"findin":{},"catalo":{},"type":{},"full":"his superior in of/ice, any information respecting
orders which he may have received, or any regulation that may he made for the government of
the department.
Sec. 11. Each member shall always have with
him a memorandum book, in which he shall enter
the names of such persons whom he may have
taken in custody ; and also such matters in each
case as will be important on the trial of the cause.
Sec. 12. Each member of the department shall
wear the emblem of office on his left breast, on
the outside of his outer garment.
Sec. 13. Lieutenants, Sergeants, and Policemen shall at all times and on all occasions, when
on duty, conspicuously display their crescent or
emblem of office.
Sec. 14. No member of the Police Department
shall leave the City without permission from the
Mayor.
Sec. 15. All persons who may be arrested during the time the Recorder's Courts may be open
in accordance with existing laws, shall be conveyed immediately to the Recorder's Court in the
District to which the policeman who made the
arrest shall be attached, unless otherwise directed","fullrs":{},"find":"2650.jp2","dmaccess":{},"dmimage":{},"dmcreated":"2012-01-18","dmmodified":"2012-01-18","dmoclcno":{},"dmrecord":"2649","restrictionCode":"1","cdmfilesize":"469438","cdmfilesizeformatted":"0.45 MB","cdmprintpdf":"0","cdmhasocr":"1","cdmisnewspaper":"0"}
